column4: I'm on broadband, but I don't have a CD-rom burner, only a Cd-rom reader. IS there a free/shareware Partitioning program for Windows XP that I can download from the net, and that would allow me to partition my hard drive from the hard drive (not from CD-rom)?
i checked out the websites of qparted and gparted. Looks like they are for linux.
you can partition a hardisk with a live CD you know
I havent tried Ubuntu live but there are lots of live CD's like knoppix and PClinuxOS with graphical partitioning tools
